etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in American Naturalist. From scientific Latin Pelmatozoa, subphylum name + -an: compare -zoan

definitions: An echinoderm which is fixed to the substrate by a stalk; a member of the subphylum Pelmatozoa comprising such forms, including crinoids, blastoids, and cystoids.
Of, relating to, or characteristic of those echinoderms which are fixed to the substrate by a stalk; of or relating to the subphylum Pelmatozoa.
